segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 3. Anuttariyavagga
segments.en: 3. Unsurpassable

segments.pli: 26. Mahākaccānasutta
segments.en: 26. With Mahākaccāna

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahākaccāno bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There Mahākaccāna addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “āvuso bhikkhave”ti.
segments.en: “Reverends, mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākaccānassa paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Reverend,” they replied.

segments.pli: Āyasmā mahākaccāno etadavoca:
segments.en: Venerable Mahākaccāna said this:

segments.pli: “acchariyaṃ, āvuso;
segments.en: “It’s incredible, reverends,

segments.pli: abbhutaṃ, āvuso.
segments.en: it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Yāvañcidaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sambādhe okāsādhigamo anubuddho sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṃ cha anussatiṭṭhānāni.
segments.en: How this Blessed One who knows and sees, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, has found an opening in a confined space; that is, the six topics for recollection. They are in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.

segments.pli: Katamāni cha?
segments.en: What six?

segments.pli: Idhāvuso, ariyasāvako tathāgataṃ anussarati:
segments.en: Firstly, a noble disciple recollects the Realized One:

segments.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’ti.
segments.en: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye ariyasāvako tathāgataṃ anussarati nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects the Realized One their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti, nikkhantaṃ muttaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ gedhamhā.
segments.en: At that time their mind is unswerving. They’ve left behind greed; they’re free of it and have risen above it.

segments.pli: ‘Gedho’ti kho, āvuso, pañcannetaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
segments.en: ‘Greed’ is a term for the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

segments.pli: Sa kho so, āvuso, ariyasāvako sabbaso ākāsasamena cetasā viharati vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: That noble disciple meditates with a heart just like space, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Idampi kho, āvuso, ārammaṇaṃ karitvā evam’idhekacce sattā visuddhidhammā bhavanti. (1)
segments.en: Relying on this, some sentient beings have the factors for purity.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, ariyasāvako dhammaṃ anussarati:
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple recollects the teaching:

segments.pli: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo … pe … paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
segments.en: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye ariyasāvako dhammaṃ anussarati nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects the teaching their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion. …

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti, nikkhantaṃ muttaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ gedhamhā.
‘Gedho’ti kho, āvuso, pañcannetaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sa kho so, āvuso, ariyasāvako sabbaso ākāsasamena cetasā viharati vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
Idampi kho, āvuso, ārammaṇaṃ karitvā evam’idhekacce sattā visuddhidhammā bhavanti. (2)
Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, ariyasāvako saṅghaṃ anussarati:
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple recollects the Saṅgha:

segments.pli: ‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā’ti.
segments.en: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, straightforward, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye ariyasāvako saṅghaṃ anussarati nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects the Saṅgha their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion. …

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti, nikkhantaṃ muttaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ gedhamhā.
‘Gedho’ti kho, āvuso, pañcannetaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sa kho so, āvuso, ariyasāvako sabbaso ākāsasamena cetasā viharati vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
Idampi kho, āvuso, ārammaṇaṃ karitvā evam’idhekacce sattā visuddhidhammā bhavanti. (3)
Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikāni.
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple recollects their own ethical precepts, which are unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye ariyasāvako attano sīlaṃ anussarati nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects their ethical precepts their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion. …

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti, nikkhantaṃ muttaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ gedhamhā.
‘Gedho’ti kho, āvuso, pañcannetaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sa kho so, āvuso, ariyasāvako sabbaso ākāsasamena cetasā viharati vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
Idampi kho, āvuso, ārammaṇaṃ karitvā evam’idhekacce sattā visuddhidhammā bhavanti. (4)
Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, ariyasāvako attano cāgaṃ anussarati:
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple recollects their own generosity:

segments.pli: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me … pe …
segments.en: ‘I’m so fortunate, so very fortunate!

segments.pli: yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato’ti.
segments.en: Among people full of the stain of stinginess I live at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.’

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye ariyasāvako attano cāgaṃ anussarati nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects their own generosity their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion. …

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti, nikkhantaṃ muttaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ gedhamhā.
‘Gedho’ti kho, āvuso, pañcannetaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sa kho so, āvuso, ariyasāvako sabbaso ākāsasamena cetasā viharati vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
Idampi kho, āvuso, ārammaṇaṃ karitvā evam’idhekacce sattā visuddhidhammā bhavanti. (5)
Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, ariyasāvako devatā anussarati:
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple recollects the deities:

segments.pli: ‘santi devā cātumahārājikā, santi devā … pe … tatuttari.
segments.en: ‘There are the Gods of the Four Great Kings, the Gods of the Thirty-Three, the Gods of Yama, the Joyful Gods, the Gods Who Love to Create, the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others, the Gods of Brahmā’s Host, and gods even higher than these.

segments.pli: Yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tattha upapannā;
segments.en: When those deities passed away from here, they were reborn there because of their faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

segments.pli: mayhampi tathārūpā saddhā saṃvijjati. Yathārūpena sīlena … sutena … cāgena … paññāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tattha upapannā; mayhampi tathārūpā paññā saṃvijjatī’ti.
segments.en: I, too, have the same kind of faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.’

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye ariyasāvako attano ca tāsañca devatānaṃ saddhañca sīlañca sutañca cāgañca paññañca anussarati nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects the faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom of both themselves and the deities their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti, nikkhantaṃ muttaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ gedhamhā.
segments.en: At that time their mind is unswerving. They’ve left behind greed; they’re free of it and have risen above it.

segments.pli: ‘Gedho’ti kho, āvuso, pañcannetaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
segments.en: ‘Greed’ is a term for the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

segments.pli: Sa kho so, āvuso, ariyasāvako sabbaso ākāsasamena cetasā viharati vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.
segments.en: That noble disciple meditates with a heart just like space, abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

segments.pli: Idampi kho, āvuso, ārammaṇaṃ karitvā evam’idhekacce sattā visuddhidhammā bhavanti. (6)
segments.en: Relying on this, some sentient beings have the factors for purity.

segments.pli: Acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso.
segments.en: It’s incredible, reverends, it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Yāvañcidaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sambādhe okāsādhigamo anubuddho sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṃ cha anussatiṭṭhānānī”ti.
segments.en: How this Blessed One who knows and sees, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, has found an opening in a confined space; that is, the six topics for recollection. They are in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Mahākaccāna teaches that the six recollections are a way to escape from greed and lead to a mind as vast as space.
